sentences.en: a coat with a fur collar
a collar and cuffs of white lace
sentences.cn: 带白色蕾丝花边的衣领和袖口

sentences.en: Beattie managed to collar Atkins in a hallway.
sentences.cn: 贝蒂设法在走廊里拦住了阿特金斯，和他谈了几句话。

sentences.en: He buttoned his collar tightly round his thick neck.
sentences.cn: 他把衣领的扣子扣上，紧紧地裹住了他的粗脖子。

sentences.en: He grabbed me by the collar.
He loosened his collar and tie .
He loosened his collar and tie.
He wore a plain blue shirt, open at the collar.
sentences.cn: 他穿一件素净的蓝色衬衫，领口敞着。

sentences.en: His collar bone only hurt when he lifted his arm.
sentences.cn: 他的锁骨只有在抬臂时才感觉到痛。

sentences.en: I stepped outside and pulled up my collar against the cold mist.
sentences.cn: 我走出门，竖起衣领抵御冷雾。

sentences.en: Mike kept snatching him up by the collar and jerking him up.
sentences.cn: 迈克一直揪着他的领子把他往上猛举。

sentences.en: Mr Penrose made a grab at his collar.
sentences.cn: 彭罗斯先生试图揪住他的衣领。

sentences.en: She eyed his unruly collar-length hair with disfavour.
sentences.cn: 她反感地盯着他那长及衣领的一头乱发。

sentences.en: She was wearing a black coat with a white collar.
sentences.cn: 她穿着一件白领黑外套。
她的口水流到了领子上。

sentences.en: Some of you were getting very hot under the collar about Royals.
sentences.cn: 你们当中有些人对皇室成员非常恼火。

sentences.en: The collar was embroidered with very small red strawberries.
sentences.cn: 衣领上绣着非常小的红色草莓。

sentences.en: There was a piece of cloth tied to the dog's collar.

phrases.tran_cn: (马上坡时)轭具擦痛肩膀；费力地

trans.tran_en: the part of a shirt, coat etc that fits around your neck, and is usually folded over

trans.tran_cn: 抓住，逮住，拦住（某人与其）谈话
trans.tran_en: to catch someone and hold them so that they cannot escape
